metadata.description: Cultural events 1933-1957: films, books, theater, concerts, art

1933-03-02.title: King Kong
1933-03-02.creator: Merian C. Cooper, Ernest B. Schoedsack
1933-03-02.description: Revolutionary special effects film premieres at Radio City Music Hall. Fay Wray stars.

1933-12-06.title: Duck Soup
1933-12-06.creator: Leo McCarey, Marx Brothers
1933-12-06.description: Marx Brothers' anarchic political satire released. Later considered their masterpiece.

1934-11-21.title: Anything Goes
1934-11-21.creator: Cole Porter
1934-11-21.description: Cole Porter musical opens on Broadway. Ethel Merman stars. 'I Get a Kick Out of You.'

1935-10-10.title: Porgy and Bess
1935-10-10.creator: George Gershwin
1935-10-10.description: Gershwin's 'folk opera' premieres at Alvin Theatre. 'Summertime' becomes jazz standard.

1935-08-21.title: Benny Goodman launches Swing Era
1935-08-21.creator: Benny Goodman
1935-08-21.description: Palomar Ballroom concert in Los Angeles ignites national swing dance craze.

1936-03-02.title: MoMA: Cubism and Abstract Art
1936-03-02.creator: Alfred H. Barr Jr.
1936-03-02.description: Landmark exhibition defines modernist canon. First comprehensive survey of abstract art.

1937-07-12.title: Guernica exhibited
1937-07-12.creator: Pablo Picasso
1937-07-12.description: Picasso's anti-war masterpiece shown at Spanish Republic pavilion, Paris World's Fair.

1937-06-16.title: The Cradle Will Rock
1937-06-16.creator: Marc Blitzstein
1937-06-16.description: Federal Theatre Project banned. Orson Welles stages legendary unauthorized performance at Venice Theatre.

1938-01-16.title: Benny Goodman at Carnegie Hall
1938-01-16.creator: Benny Goodman
1938-01-16.description: First jazz concert at Carnegie Hall. Historic integrated performance with Lionel Hampton.

1938-02-04.title: Our Town
1938-02-04.creator: Thornton Wilder
1938-02-04.description: Pulitzer Prize play premieres. Innovative staging without sets in Grover's Corners, NH.

1939-03-28.title: The Philadelphia Story
1939-03-28.creator: Philip Barry
1939-03-28.description: Katharine Hepburn stars on Broadway at Shubert Theatre. Play revives her career.

1939-04-09.title: Marian Anderson at Lincoln Memorial
1939-04-09.creator: Marian Anderson
1939-04-09.description: After DAR ban, contralto performs for 75,000 at Lincoln Memorial, Easter Sunday.

1939-08-17.title: The Wizard of Oz
1939-08-17.creator: Victor Fleming
1939-08-17.description: Judy Garland stars in MGM's Technicolor fantasy. 'Somewhere Over the Rainbow' becomes iconic.

1939-12-15.title: Gone with the Wind
1939-12-15.creator: Victor Fleming
1939-12-15.description: David O. Selznick's Civil War epic premieres in Atlanta. Vivien Leigh and Clark Gable star.

1940-12-25.title: Pal Joey
1940-12-25.creator: Rodgers and Hart
1940-12-25.description: Dark musical about heel nightclub entertainer. Gene Kelly stars on Broadway.

1941-01-23.title: Duke Ellington at Carnegie Hall
1941-01-23.creator: Duke Ellington
1941-01-23.description: Ellington premieres 'Black, Brown and Beige' - 45-minute tone poem of African American history.

1941-05-01.title: Citizen Kane
1941-05-01.creator: Orson Welles
1941-05-01.description: Welles' directorial debut revolutionizes cinema with deep focus photography and non-linear narrative.

1942-10-20.title: Peggy Guggenheim opens Art of This Century
1942-10-20.creator: Peggy Guggenheim
1942-10-20.description: Gallery designed by Frederick Kiesler showcases Surrealism and emerging Abstract Expressionists.

1942-11-26.title: Casablanca
1942-11-26.creator: Michael Curtiz
1942-11-26.description: Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman in wartime romance. 'Here's looking at you, kid.'

1943-03-31.title: Oklahoma!
1943-03-31.creator: Rodgers and Hammerstein
1943-03-31.description: Revolutionary musical integrates song, dance, and story. Opens at St. James Theatre.

1944-12-26.title: The Glass Menagerie
1944-12-26.creator: Tennessee Williams
1944-12-26.description: Williams' breakthrough 'memory play' premieres in Chicago. Laurette Taylor stars.

1945-04-19.title: Carousel
1945-04-19.creator: Rodgers and Hammerstein
1945-04-19.description: Dark musical adaptation of Liliom at Majestic Theatre. 'You'll Never Walk Alone' becomes anthem.

1946-05-16.title: Annie Get Your Gun
1946-05-16.creator: Irving Berlin
1946-05-16.description: Ethel Merman as Annie Oakley at Imperial Theatre. 'There's No Business Like Show Business.'

1946-12-20.title: It's a Wonderful Life
1946-12-20.creator: Frank Capra
1946-12-20.description: James Stewart stars in holiday classic. Initial box office failure becomes beloved tradition.

1947-08-08.title: Pollock in Life magazine
1947-08-08.creator: Jackson Pollock
1947-08-08.description: Life asks: 'Is he the greatest living painter in the United States?' Abstract Expressionism enters mainstream.

1947-12-03.title: A Streetcar Named Desire
1947-12-03.creator: Tennessee Williams
1947-12-03.description: Marlon Brando as Stanley Kowalski at Ethel Barrymore Theatre. 'I have always depended on the kindness of strangers.'

1948-01-14.title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
1948-01-14.creator: John Huston
1948-01-14.description: Premiere in Los Angeles. Humphrey Bogart, Walter Huston. 3 Oscars including Best Director.

1948-04-30.title: Inside U.S.A.
1948-04-30.creator: Arthur Schwartz, Howard Dietz
1948-04-30.description: Musical revue opens at New Century Theatre. Beatrice Lillie, Jack Haley. 339 performances.

1948-06-21.title: LP records introduced
1948-06-21.creator: Columbia Records
1948-06-21.description: 33 1/3 RPM long-playing record unveiled at Waldorf Astoria press conference. 10" and 12" formats.

1949-02-10.title: Death of a Salesman
1949-02-10.creator: Arthur Miller
1949-02-10.description: Pulitzer Prize play at Morosco Theatre. Lee J. Cobb as Willy Loman. 'Attention must be paid.'

1949-04-07.title: South Pacific
1949-04-07.creator: Rodgers and Hammerstein
1949-04-07.description: Pulitzer Prize musical addresses racism at Majestic Theatre. 'You've Got to Be Carefully Taught.'

1950-01-21.title: The Cocktail Party
1950-01-21.creator: T.S. Eliot
1950-01-21.description: Eliot's verse drama opens on Broadway at Henry Miller's Theatre. Rex Harrison stars.

1950-08-25.title: Sunset Boulevard
1950-08-25.creator: Billy Wilder
1950-08-25.description: Gloria Swanson as faded silent film star. 'I'm ready for my close-up, Mr. DeMille.'

1951-03-29.title: The King and I
1951-03-29.creator: Rodgers and Hammerstein
1951-03-29.description: Gertrude Lawrence and Yul Brynner in Siam-set musical at St. James Theatre.

1951-09-28.title: A Streetcar Named Desire
1951-09-28.creator: Elia Kazan
1951-09-28.description: Marlon Brando's breakthrough as Stanley Kowalski. Tennessee Williams adaptation.

1952-04-11.title: Singin' in the Rain
1952-04-11.creator: Stanley Donen, Gene Kelly
1952-04-11.description: Gene Kelly's masterpiece musical about Hollywood's transition to talkies.

1952-08-29.title: John Cage's 4'33"
1952-08-29.creator: John Cage
1952-08-29.description: David Tudor premieres silent composition at Woodstock, NY. Audience sounds become the music.

1953-01-05.title: Waiting for Godot
1953-01-05.creator: Samuel Beckett
1953-01-05.description: Absurdist masterpiece premieres at Theatre de Babylone, Paris. 'Nothing happens, twice.'

1953-01-22.title: The Crucible
1953-01-22.creator: Arthur Miller
1953-01-22.description: Salem witch trials as McCarthy allegory at Martin Beck Theatre. Miller later called before HUAC.

1954-03-24.title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
1954-03-24.creator: Tennessee Williams
1954-03-24.description: Pulitzer Prize play at Morosco Theatre. Brick's secrets and Big Daddy's death in Mississippi Delta.

1954-07-29.title: Rear Window
1954-07-29.creator: Alfred Hitchcock
1954-07-29.description: James Stewart and Grace Kelly in Hitchcock's voyeuristic thriller set in one apartment.

1954-10-15.title: Rauschenberg Erased de Kooning
1954-10-15.creator: Robert Rauschenberg
1954-10-15.description: Rauschenberg erases de Kooning drawing as conceptual art statement.

1955-01-24.title: The Family of Man
1955-01-24.creator: Edward Steichen
1955-01-24.description: MoMA photography exhibition. 503 photos from 68 countries. 'The greatest exhibition of all time.'

1955-03-30.title: Rebel Without a Cause
1955-03-30.creator: Nicholas Ray
1955-03-30.description: James Dean as troubled teenager. Released after Dean's death in September car crash.

1956-02-07.title: Long Day's Journey Into Night
1956-02-07.creator: Eugene O'Neill
1956-02-07.description: Posthumous world premiere in Stockholm of O'Neill's autobiographical masterpiece.

1956-03-15.title: My Fair Lady
1956-03-15.creator: Lerner and Loewe
1956-03-15.description: Rex Harrison and Julie Andrews in Pygmalion adaptation at Mark Hellinger Theatre.

1956-10-05.title: Giant
1956-10-05.creator: George Stevens
1956-10-05.description: James Dean's final film with Elizabeth Taylor and Rock Hudson. Epic Texas saga.

1957-04-20.title: 12 Angry Men
1957-04-20.creator: Sidney Lumet
1957-04-20.description: Henry Fonda in claustrophobic jury room drama. Lumet's directorial debut.

1957-09-26.title: West Side Story
1957-09-26.creator: Leonard Bernstein, Stephen Sondheim
1957-09-26.description: Modern Romeo and Juliet in NYC streets at Winter Garden Theatre. Jerome Robbins choreography.

1933-10.title: Man's Fate (La Condition Humaine)
1933-10.creator: Andre Malraux
1933-10.description: Novel about Shanghai Communist uprising wins Prix Goncourt. Major existentialist work.

1934-04.title: Tender Is the Night
1934-04.creator: F. Scott Fitzgerald
1934-04.description: Fitzgerald's fourth novel about American expatriates on the French Riviera.

1936-10.title: Absalom, Absalom!
1936-10.creator: William Faulkner
1936-10.description: Faulkner's complex Southern Gothic masterpiece. Multiple narrators tell story of Thomas Sutpen.

1937-02.title: Of Mice and Men
1937-02.creator: John Steinbeck
1937-02.description: Novella about migrant workers George and Lennie during Great Depression.

1938-04.title: Nausea (La Nausee)
1938-04.creator: Jean-Paul Sartre
1938-04.description: Sartre's first novel introduces existentialist themes. Diary of Antoine Roquentin.

1939-04.title: The Grapes of Wrath
1939-04.creator: John Steinbeck
1939-04.description: Pulitzer Prize novel follows Joad family from Oklahoma Dust Bowl to California.

1940-10.title: For Whom the Bell Tolls
1940-10.creator: Ernest Hemingway
1940-10.description: American volunteer in Spanish Civil War. Robert Jordan's three days behind enemy lines.

1942-06.title: The Stranger (L'Etranger)
1942-06.creator: Albert Camus
1942-06.description: Camus' absurdist novel. Meursault's emotional detachment from mother's death and murder.

1943-04.title: The Little Prince
1943-04.creator: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
1943-04.description: French aviator's beloved fable published in New York. 'What is essential is invisible to the eye.'

1945-08.title: Animal Farm
1945-08.creator: George Orwell
1945-08.description: Allegorical novella satirizing Soviet totalitarianism. 'All animals are equal, but some are more equal.'

1946-08.title: All the King's Men
1946-08.creator: Robert Penn Warren
1946-08.description: Pulitzer Prize novel based loosely on Huey Long. Political corruption in the South.

1947-06.title: The Plague (La Peste)
1947-06.creator: Albert Camus
1947-06.description: Existentialist allegory of epidemic in Algerian city. Dr. Rieux fights bubonic plague.

1948-05.title: The Naked and the Dead
1948-05.creator: Norman Mailer
1948-05.description: Mailer's debut novel about U.S. Army platoon in Pacific. Based on his WWII service.

1949-06.creator: George Orwell
1949-06.description: Dystopian masterpiece. Big Brother, Newspeak, and thoughtcrime enter the language.

1951-07.title: The Catcher in the Rye
1951-07.creator: J.D. Salinger
1951-07.description: Holden Caulfield's alienated journey through New York. Iconic voice of teenage rebellion.

1952-04.title: Invisible Man
1952-04.creator: Ralph Ellison
1952-04.description: National Book Award winner. African American narrator's journey through racism and identity.

1952-09.title: East of Eden
1952-09.creator: John Steinbeck
1952-09.description: Steinbeck's epic retelling of Cain and Abel in Salinas Valley, California.

1952-09.title: de Kooning's Woman I
1952-09.creator: Willem de Kooning
1952-09.description: Controversial Abstract Expressionist figure painting completed after 2 years of work.

1953-10.title: Fahrenheit 451
1953-10.creator: Ray Bradbury
1953-10.description: Dystopia where firemen burn books. 'It was a pleasure to burn.'

1954-09.title: Lord of the Flies
1954-09.creator: William Golding
1954-09.description: British schoolboys stranded on island descend into savagery. Nobel Prize winner's debut.

1955-09.title: Lolita
1955-09.creator: Vladimir Nabokov
1955-09.description: Published in Paris after U.S. rejection. 'Light of my life, fire of my loins.'

1955-11.title: Howl and Other Poems
1955-11.creator: Allen Ginsberg
1955-11.description: Beat poetry manifesto by City Lights. 'I saw the best minds of my generation destroyed by madness.'

1957-09.title: On the Road
1957-09.creator: Jack Kerouac
1957-09.description: Beat Generation bible. Sal Paradise and Dean Moriarty's cross-country adventures.
